pull.title: test: #29007 follow ups
pull.body: A few, small follow-ups to #29007. See commit messages for details.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage
For detailed information about the code coverage, see the [test coverage report](https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/29636).
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [stratospher](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29636#pullrequestreview-1956538029), [mzumsande](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29636#pullrequestreview-1956647302), [maflcko](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29636#issuecomment-2017349587) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with 👎 to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#29641](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29641) (scripted-diff: Use LogInfo/LogDebug over LogPrintf/LogPrint by maflcko)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Since `addpeeraddress` can currently fail to add an address to the `tried` table but will report `{ success: true }`, it makes sense to get that fixed with #28998 first before this PR, especially the first commit, is ready for review. The other two commits are minor and can wait.

verification.payload:
tree 713da0caf5bd7b427eaa2d9db3935c2fd1db34be
parent c1223188e0a5fb11c3a1b9224511a49dc2f848ed
author 0xb10c <b10c@b10c.me> 1710256621 +0100
committer 0xb10c <b10c@b10c.me> 1711204418 +0100

test: check that addrman seeding is successful

The addpeeraddress calls can fail due to collisions. As we are using a
deteministic addrman, they won't fail with the current bucket/position
calculation. However, if the calculation is changed, they might collide
and fail silently causing tests using `seed_addrman()` to fail.

Assert that the addpeeraddress calls are successful.

events.message:
test: check that addrman seeding is successful

The addpeeraddress calls can fail due to collisions. As we are using a
deteministic addrman, they won't fail with the current bucket/position
calculation. However, if the calculation is changed, they might collide
and fail silently causing tests using `seed_addrman()` to fail.

Assert that the addpeeraddress calls are successful.

committer 0xb10c <b10c@b10c.me> 1711204427 +0100

addrman: drop /*deterministic=*/ comment

Just having deterministic is enough. See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29007#discussion_r1488241966

events.body: With https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28998 merged, this PR is now ready-for-review. I've also rebased it.

tested ACK 9a44a20.

you can also include the check in `test/functional/feature_asmap.py` since `addpeeraddress` + deterministic addrman is present there too.

comments.body: nit (feel free to ignore): If you want, you can also replace `LogPrintf` with `LogInfo` for clarity, while touching this file.
I'm not doing this for now as I think this is slightly out-of-scope of this PR even if I touch the file.
